column4: Hey guys, running gksu "update-manager -c" doesn't show a 6.06 -> 6.10 update option.
How do I upgraded distro?
make sure you have an updated 6.06 so that you have the latest version of update-manager
zyclop: The only thing keeping me from being 100% up-to-date is that Cafuego's bcm43xx won't install (I get a "size mismatch" error)
Uh... I have Dapper, dude.
you have dapper-security and dapper-updates in your sources.list, correct?
Yep.
I was going to install manually, but apt-get update exploded when I did an s/dapper/edgy/.
i think you should try to fix apt before anything else
Apt isn't broken...
exploded?
It only breaks when I do an s/dapper/edgy/.
what is the error?
reproducing the error....
It worked this time.
update-manager is still preferred
But it doesn't work.
Running gksu "update-manager -c" doesn't show an Edgy upgrade option.
glatzor: ... that worked this time, too.
i suggest using update-manager then
get back to us, before restarting
or autocloean to remove only old pkgs
